application.doc: Rebooting and enabling the FIPS Mode configuration

method.name: PUT
method.id: Rebooting and enabling the FIPS Mode configuration
method.doc: To reboot the security appliance to enable the FIPS Mode configuration after making changes, issue a PUT request to the FIPS Mode endpoint.
When automating this process, it is possible to programatically determine when the security appliance has completed the reboot operation.

Use the Firmware Settings API (Manage: System Settings > Updates and Licensing > Firmware Settings > Retrieving a list of firmware settings) to observe the last_boot parameter before issuing the restart request, then subsequently poll this same API for a change to last_boot.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: The security appliance is now rebooting. When the appliance has booted up again, it will now be running in FIPS mode.
The First Steps setup has already been completed. FIPS mode can only be configured during the First Steps setup process.
